Legal_Issue: Whether it was reasonable for the RAD to reject new evidence and apply the reasonableness standard of review
Evidence_Assessment: Birth certificates initially submitted; later a letter from community witnesses was submitted but rejected by RAD
Decision_Outcome: RPD and RAD denied refugee protection due to credibility and identity issues
Credibility_Factor: Applicants' credibility and identity were central concerns in the decision-making process
Legal_Rule: RAD must conduct a 'full fact-based appeal' under IRPA, allowing submission of new evidence not previously available
Standard_of_Review: Correctness standard should have been applied instead of reasonableness
Procedural_Issue: RAD failed to consider that applicants were unaware of witnesses' presence in Toronto when new evidence was submitted
Grounds_for_Claim: Refugee protection based on fear of persecution linked to identity and credibility
Outcome_on_Merits: Not determined – case remitted for reassessment
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Federal Court found RAD's decision unreasonable
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court found procedural unfairness in rejection of new evidence without proper justification
Key_Evidence_Considered: Birth certificates, Letter from community witnesses
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to RAD’s rejection of new evidence and incorrect standard of review
Court_Result: Application for judicial review allowed; case remitted to RAD for reconsideration with inclusion of the letter as evidence
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (birth certificates), Affidavit/Statement evidence (community letter)
Remedy_Requested: Reconsideration of refugee appeal with inclusion of new evidence
Outcome: Case remitted to RAD for reassessment of identity and credibility using the new evidence
Remedy_Sought: Remittal of the case for re-hearing before the RAD
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by remittal for administrative reconsideration
Legal_Provision: Section of IRPA governing RAD appeals and new evidence
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on full fact-based appeal and new evidence
Outcome_of_Review: Successful judicial review; decision set aside and remitted
Governing_Rule: RAD must accept new evidence if not reasonably available at prior hearing and apply correctness standard where appropriate
